alert.note: Alert for Houghton; Keweenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Keweenaw and northeastern Houghton Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 907 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over The Upper Entrance of Portage Canal, or 7 miles northwest of Houghton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Houghton County Airport and Dollar Bay around 915 PM EDT. Calumet, Laurium, Lake Linden and Hubbell around 920 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Gay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for western Upper Michigan.
